metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3594 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: An invalid pointer initialization issue was found in the SLiRP networking implementation of QEMU. The flaw exists in the udp_input() function and could occur while processing a udp packet that is smaller than the size of the 'udphdr' structure. This issue may lead to out-of-bounds read access or indirect host memory disclosure to the guest. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality. This flaw affects libslirp versions prior to 4.6.0.

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
